title: Penguins sink Senators for first win of season | Hockey
text:
PITTSBURGH -- Evgeni Malkin gave the Penguins their first lead of the season 23 seconds into the second period Thursday night to spark a 2-0 win over the Ottawa Senators.
And really, it was not a moment too soon.
Malkin skated in from the right wing, balanced on one foot, then lined a shot just inside goalie Craig Anderson's blocker for his first goal of the season.
Just 2:02 later, rookie Daniel Sprong scored the first goal of his NHL career.
Sprong roofed a shot past Anderson from the hash marks in the slot off a feed from Matt Cullen and jumped up against the boards to celebrate the milestone.
After an 0-3 start to the season, it was a much-needed victory for the Penguins. The club took 16 first-period shots and were creating chances early.
The power play still didn't convert (0-for-3) but the penalty kill was in midseason form and did not allow a shot-against over the course of two consecutive power plays by the Senators. Ottawa finished 0-for-3 on the man advantage.
Marc-Andre Fleury, who finished with a 21-save shutout, turned away a Bobby Ryan shot off an odd man rush in the first period to preserve a scoreless game.
The Penguins next face the Toronto Maple Leafs on Saturday.
